data.title: University of the East Ramon Magsaysay 2024
data.meta_description: The University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Philippines 2024-25: Admission Procedure, Courses, Fee Structure, Eligibility Criteria, Ranking, Documents etc.
data.text:
University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Philippines was founded in 1956. In June of that year, the UERM Memorial Medical Center was renamed as a tribute to President Ramon Magsaysay Sr., who had tragically died in a plane crash a few months prior. This is one of the top colleges for MBBS in Philippines.

The University of the East Ramon Magsaysay in the Philippines, established in 1957, is a non-stock, non-profit foundation dedicated to honouring President Ramon Magsaysay. It offers various degrees recognized by the Commission on Higher Education as Centers of Excellence. Additionally, it holds level IV recognition from the Philippine Accrediting Association of Schools, Colleges, and Universities (PAASCU).

University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Courses Offered

University of the East Ramon Magsaysay in the Philippines offers high-quality medical programs with experienced faculty and modern facilities. The college is well-known for its undergraduate medical program (MBBS).

University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Admission Procedure

To apply for admission to University of the East Ramon Magsaysay in 2024, you need to pass the National Eligibility Entrance Exam (NEET). Keep in mind that meeting the eligibility requirements is essential. Here are some helpful resources to improve your NEET exam preparation.

University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Eligibility Criteria

The Philippines is among the top choices for international students studying Medicine abroad. If you’re interested in pursuing an MBBS degree at University of the East Ramon Magsaysay, review the eligibility criteria provided below.

University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Document Required

Before taking Admission, please do not forget to carry all these related documents.

Passport (Minimum 18 months validity).

Class 10th Passing Certificate & Mark sheet.

Class 12th Passing Certificate & Mark sheet.

Birth Certificate.

Ten passport-size Photographs

Official Invitation letter from the University of East Ramon Magsaysay Medical College Philippines

Authorization of all documents from the Ministry of External Affairs, New Delhi.

Legalization of all documents from the University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Medical College Philippines.

Visa fees.

Bank receipt of 1st Year of University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Tuition fee (required for some Universities).

Medical test documents.

About the Philippines

The Philippines, known officially as the Republic of the Philippines, is a country made up of thousands of islands in the western Pacific Ocean. These islands are grouped into three main regions: Luzon, Visayas, and Mindanao, stretching from north to south.
